intro: Persicaria vernalis, commonly known as spring smartweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to red, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its stems are often reddish and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, disturbed soils such as wetlands or along stream banks. Persicaria vernalis is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
